data.Description: Jeff can equip this weapon.
data.Location: Replaces the Broken Harmonica in Jeff's inventory after the item has been repaired.

data.Description: Ness can equip this weapon. This item looks like it could have had cork put into the core!
A pretty powerful weapon.

data.Comments: Lots of power, but you'll whiff most of the time.
data.Description: Ness can equip this weapon. You can't help but swing this bat with all your might. There's a good chance that you may just whiff.
data.Note: This weapon is most likely a reference to the poem Casey At Bat, a poem about how a well-known baseball player makes incredibly strong swings, but misses all three pitches and is struck out.

data.Description: Paula can equip this weapon.

data.Comments: Decreases Poo's Offense when equipped.
data.Description: This one rocks, for sure.

data.Comments: Ness's first weapon.
data.Description: Ness can equip this weapon.
data.Location: Onett (Gift Box in Ness's House or Drugstore)

data.Description: Jeff can equip this weapon.
Jeff can equip this weapon.
Paula can equip this weapon.
Jeff can equip this weapon.
data.Location: Replaces a Broken Gadget in Jeff's inventory after the item is repaired.

data.Description: Paula can equip this weapon.

data.Comments: Paula's first weapon.
data.Description: Paula can equip this weapon.

data.Comments: Jeff's Ultimate Weapon. Jeff must repair the Broken Antenna to obtain this weapon.
data.Description: Jeff can equip this weapon.

data.Comments: Increases Guts by 127.
data.Description: Find it from the Bionic Kraken in the Cave Of The Past.
data.Notes: This item was erroneously stated to be dropped by the three Krakens in Magicant by the player's guide.

data.Description: Ness can equip this weapon.

data.Comments: Paula's ultimate weapon. Increases Guts by 10.
data.Description: Paula can equip this weapon.
Jeff can equip this weapon.

data.Comments: Jeff must repair the Broken laser to obtain this weapon.

data.Comments: Ness's ultimate weapon
data.Description: Ness can equip this weapon.

data.Comments: Increases Guts by 100, but you'll miss more often, too.
data.Description: Get one from a Chomposaur, if you can. for Paula
Ness can equip this weapon.

data.Comments: Jeff must repair the Broken Air Gun to obtain this weapon.

Ness can equip this weapon.
Jeff can equip this weapon.
Ness can equip this weapon.
Paula can equip this weapon.

data.Comments: Jeff's first weapon.
data.Description: Jeff can equip this weapon.

data.Description: Ness can equip this weapon.
A decent little weapon.

data.Comments: Jeff must repair the Broken Cannon to obtain this weapon.
data.Description: Jeff can equip this weapon.
data.Location: Bought from the Scaraba Tool Shop

data.Description: Jeff can equip this weapon.

data.Comments: Poo's ultimate weapon.
data.Description: Poo can equip this weapon. It increases your Offense.
data.Notes: This is the only weapon Poo can equip that increases his offense. It can only be obtained through a 1/128 chance drop from a Starman Super.

data.Description: Ness can equip this weapon.
Ness can equip this weapon.
data.Location: Onett (Drugstore), Twoson (Department Store), Happy Happy Village (Drugstore)

data.Description: Paula can equip this weapon.
Jeff can equip this weapon.

data.Comments: Decreases Poo's Offense when equipped.
data.Description: A tough, strong weapon.
Ness can equip this weapon.

data.Comments: Decreases Poo's Offense when equipped.
data.Description: A so-so weapon.
Jeff can equip this weapon.
Must be equipped as "other." It has the logo of your favorite baseball team. Can only be equipped by Ness.

data.Comments: Can be used only by Poo. Increases Luck by 35. Protects against Sleep.
data.Description: To be equipped on Poo's arm. Helps protect from being hypnotized, and Luck goes up. Of course, Defense also goes up.
data.Location: Cave of the Pink Cloud (Gift Box)

data.Comments: Increases Luck by 20.
data.Description: Must be equipped as "other." Increases your Defense and Luck.
Must be equipped on your arm. It increases your Defense.

data.Comments: Provides protection against Sleep. Increases Luck by 20.
data.Description: Must be equipped on your arm. It increases your Defense. Helps keep you from being hypnotized, and it also increases your Luck.

data.Comments: Can be used only by Poo. Increases his Speed by 40.
data.Description: Poo's body equipment. It increases his Defense.

data.Comments: Increases Luck by 13.
data.Description: Must be equipped as "other." Increases your Defense and Luck.
data.Location: Fourside (Department Store), Desert Gold Mine (Gift Box), Summers (Grocery Store)

data.Comments: Increases Luck by 16.
data.Description: Must be equipped as "other." Increases your Defense and Luck.

data.Comments: Increases Luck by 10.
data.Description: Must be equipped as "other." Increases your Defense and Luck.
Must be equipped on your arm. It increases your Defense.
data.Location: Twoson (Burglin Park), Happy Happy Village (Drugstore), Threed (Drugstore)

data.Comments: Speed increases by 15. Provides protection from Paralysis.
data.Description: Must be equipped on your body. It protects you from paralysis attacks. It also increases your Speed.

data.Comments: Can be used only by Paula. Increases her Luck by 15.
data.Description: Miscellaneous equipment that can only be used by Paula. When equipped, Luck is increased.

data.Comments: Can be used only by Poo. Increases Luck by 30. Weakens enemy PSI attacks. Also grants him some resistance to Fire, Freeze, Flash, and Paralysis
data.Description: Miscellaneous equipment that can only be used by Poo. It increases his Defense.
Must be equipped on your arm. Increases your Defense.
data.Location: Summers (Drugstore), The Pyramid (Gift Box), Deep Darkness (Trading Company Employee)
data.Price: $9998 (in Summers), $5198 (in Deep Darkness, sold by the businessman)

data.Comments: Provides protection from Fire, Freeze and Flash.
data.Description: Must be equipped on your body. It protects you from fire, freeze and flash attacks.

data.Comments: Provides protection from Fire.
data.Description: Must be equipped on your body. It protects you from fire attacks.
data.Location: Monkey Cave (Chest), Saturn Valley (Drugstore) (after obtaining the Meteorite piece)

data.Comments: Provides protection from Sleep. Increases Luck by 30.
data.Description: Must be equipped on your arm. It increases your Defense. Helps keep you from being hypnotized, and it also increases your Luck.

data.Comments: Paula's ultimate ribbon.
data.Description: Miscellaneous equipment that can only be used by Paula.
Must be equipped on your arm. It increases your Defense.

data.Comments: Speed increases by 5.
data.Description: Must be equipped on your body. It protects you from paralysis attacks. Also, it adds a bit of Speed.
Must be equipped as "other." Should be worn when searching for buried treasure, or while you are at the construction site.
Must be equipped as "other." It makes you feel like the great detective, Sherlock Holmes, when equipped.
data.Location: Happy Happy Village (Drugstore), Snow Wood Boarding School in Winters(Gift Box)

data.Comments: Increases Luck by 20
data.Description: Must be equipped as "other." Increases your Defense and Luck.
Must be equipped as "other." It is said to have been given to your friend by a famous player at the ballpark.

data.Comments: Increases Luck by 18.
data.Description: Must be equipped as "other." Increases your Defense and Luck. It's not money even though it's called a coin.

data.Comments: Provides protection from Flash.
data.Description: It must be equipped on your body. It absorbs the light of a flash attack.
data.Location: Moonside (Gift Box), Saturn Valley (Drugstore) (after obtaining the Meteorite piece)

data.Comments: Provides protection from Sleep. Increases Luck by 10.
data.Description: Must be equipped on your arm. It increases your Defense. Helps you from being hypnotized, and it also increases your Luck.
Must be equipped on your arm. Increases your Defense.
data.Location: Desert Gold Mine (Gift Box), Summers (Drugstore), Scaraba (Convenience Store)

data.Comments: Speed increases by 40. Provides protection from Paralysis.
data.Description: Must be equipped on your body. It protects you from paralysis attacks. It increases your Speed in a big way.

data.Comments: Provides protection from Freeze.
data.Description: Must be equipped on your body. It protects you freeze attacks.
data.Location: The Pyramid (Gift Box), Saturn Valley (Drugstore) (after obtaining the Meteorite piece)

data.Comments: Can be used only by Paula.
data.Description: Miscellaneous equipment that can only be used by Paula.

data.Comments: Can be used only by Paula.
data.Description: Miscellaneous equipment that can only be used by Paula.

data.Comments: Can be used only by Paula. Increases her Luck by 40.
data.Description: Miscellaneous equipment that can only be used by Paula. When equipped, Luck is increased. Same as the one that Mr. Saturn wears on his head.
data.Location: Given to you by a Mr. Saturn after you defeat Starman Deluxe and shut down the Stonehenge base.

data.Comments: Provides protection from Fire, Freeze and Flash.
data.Description: Must be equipped on your body. It protects you from fire, freeze and flash attacks.

data.Comments: Increases Luck by 30.
data.Description: Must be equipped as "other." It increases your Defense and Luck.
Must be equipped on your arm. It increases your Defense.
data.Location: Underground Road (Coffin), Saturn Valley (Drugstore), Dusty Dunes Desert (Drugstore), Fourside (Department Store)

data.Comments: Increases Luck by 35.
data.Description: Must be equipped as "other." Increases your Defense and Luck.

data.Comments: Provides protection from Fire, Freeze, Flash and Paralysis. This is the best pendant item in the game, though its usefulness is limited by its rarity.
data.Description: Must be equipped on your body. It protects you from fire, freeze, flash and paralysis attacks.

data.Comments: Increases Luck by 25.
data.Description: Must be equipped as "other." Increases your Defense and Luck.

data.Comments: Can be used only by Paula. Increases her Luck by 25.
data.Description: Miscellaneous equipment that can only be used by Paula. When equipped, luck is increased.

data.Comments: Provides protection from Paralysis.
data.Description: Must be equipped on your body. It protects you from paralysis attacks.
data.Location: Onett (Travelling Entertainers), Twoson (Burglin Park), Peaceful Rest Valley (Gift Box), Saturn Valley (Drugstore)

data.Comments: Needed to withdraw or deposit cash. It's possible to deposit it into Escargo Express, but all that does is remove your ability to use the ATM.
data.Description: You know, you shouldn't leave home without... It even works overseas!
data.Location: Ness begins the adventure with it in his inventory

data.Comments: Use at the Chaos Theater.
data.Description: It allows you go back stage at the Chaos Theater. Of course, you can also watch the show using the pass.
data.Location: It is given to Ness by Lucky after he becomes overjoyed at seeing Paula rescued by Ness.

data.Comments: Opens lockers in the locker room of Snow Wood Boarding School and the door of the locked cave in Threed
data.Description: The "Machine that Opens Doors, especially when you have a slightly bad key" machine.

data.Comments: Use to turn into a dragon for a single attack against your enemies.
data.Description: If you sprinkle the powder on one of your friends during battle, that friend turns into a dragon and attacks all enemies. Gone after one use.
data.Location: Monkey Cave, Tenda Village Elder, The Fire Spring (Gift Box), Magicant (Gift Box)

data.Comments: Used only by Jeff. Use to hit multiple enemies with a single attack.
data.Description: Items for Jeff. Damages an enemy when used during battle. Because of its explosive power, it may effect others besides the target creature. Can be used many times.

data.Comments: Lets only one person ride at a time, making it useless after Paula joins the party. Due to moving around faster, allows to outmaneuver foes and inhibit their spawning.
data.Description: Riding this makes you feel like whistling! You can even ring the bell by pressing the R button!

data.Comments: Used only by Jeff. Stronger than a Bottle rocket.
data.Description: Items for Jeff. Fires a fast, powerful bottle rocket. Gone after one use.
data.Location: Dusty Dunes Desert (Arms Dealer), Fourside (Arms Dealer), Desert Gold Mine (Gift Box), Scaraba (Weapon Shop), dropped by Sentry Robot

data.Comments: Use to hit multiple enemies with a single attack.
data.Description: Damages an enemy when used during battle. Because of its explosive power, it may effect others besides the target creature. Gone after one use.
data.Location: Peaceful Rest Valley (Gift Box), Threed (Arms Dealer), Grapefruit Falls (Gift Box), The Belch Base (Gift Box), Fourside (Department Store or Arms Dealer), Desert Gold Mine (Gift Box), Scaraba (Weapon Shop), dropped by Attack Slug, dropped by Trick or Trick Kid

data.Comments: Use to attack during battle.
data.Description: Items for Jeff. Damages an enemy when used during battle. Gone after one use.
data.Location: Threed (Arms Dealer), Dusty Dunes Desert (Arms Dealer), Fourside (Arms Dealer), Scaraba (Weapon Shop), dropped by Zombie Dog

data.Comments: Keeps you from being "held" in battle, a rare status that prevents use of PSI.
data.Description: A miraculous stone that enables you to "concentrate" without using your own brain. This is accomplished just by your keeping this item. This is great because if you can't concentrate, you can't use PSI.
data.Location: Poo has this item when you first start controlling him

data.Comments: Can be repaired by Jeff to produce a Gaia Beam. Requires 65 IQ to fix.
data.Description: A piece of broken equipment that looks like a satellite dish. That genius Jeff should be able to fix it sometime.

data.Comments: Can be repaired by Jeff to produce a Heavy bazooka. Requires 45 IQ to fix.
data.Description: A broken bazooka. That genius Jeff should be able to fix it sometime.

data.Comments: Can be repaired by Jeff to produce a Spectrum Beam. Requires 32 IQ to fix.
data.Description: A broken beam cannon. That genius Jeff should be able to fix it sometime.

data.Comments: Can be repaired by Jeff to produce a Double Beam. Requires 34 IQ to fix.
data.Description: There's no way of knowing its original use. It's just some kind of broken mechanism. That genius Jeff should be able to fix it sometime.

data.Comments: Can be repaired by Jeff to produce a Baddest Beam. Requires 55 IQ to fix.
data.Description: A broken device that looks like a harmonica. That genius Jeff should be able to fix it sometime.

data.Comments: Can be repaired by Jeff to produce a Slime generator. Requires 10 IQ to fix.
data.Description: A contraption that looks like an iron. That genius Jeff should be able to fix it sometime.
data.Location: Twoson (Burglin Park), Brick Road Maze (Gift Box), Fourside (Street Salesman), Fourside Sewer (Gift Box)

data.Comments: Can be repaired by Jeff to produce a Laser Gun. Requires 24 IQ to fix.
data.Description: A broken laser gun. That genius Jeff should be able to fix it sometime.

data.Comments: Can be repaired by Jeff, to produce a Counter-PSI unit. Requires 1 IQ to fix.
data.Description: There's no way of knowing its original use. It's just some kind of broken gadget. That genius Jeff should be able to fix it sometime.

data.Comments: Can be repaired by Jeff to produce a Shield killer. Requires 30 IQ to fix.
data.Description: It looks like a busted water pipe. That genius Jeff should be able to fix it sometime.
data.Location: Found in Dr. Andounts lab 2nd floor (Winters)

data.Comments: Can be repaired by Jeff to produce a Defense spray. Requires 1 IQ to fix.
data.Description: A broken spray can. That genius Jeff should be able to fix it sometime.
data.Location: Twoson (Burglin Park), Saturn Valley (Garbage), Fourside Sewer (Gift Box), dropped by Armored Frog

data.Comments: Can be repaired by Jeff to produce a Magnum Air Gun. Requires 12 IQ to fix.
data.Description: A broken air gun. That genius Jeff should be able to fix it sometime.
data.Location: Snow Wood Boarding School in Winters(Gift Box)

data.Comments: Can be repaired by Jeff to produce a Defense shower. Requires 40 IQ to fix.
data.Description: A broken apparatus that is shaped like a trumpet. That genius Jeff should be able to fix it sometime.

data.Comments: Can be repaired by Jeff to produce a Hungry HP-sucker. Requires 36 IQ to fix.
data.Description: A broken tube-shaped item. That genius Jeff should be able to fix it sometime.

data.Comments: Moves Rabbit Statues from entrance to Pink Cloud.
data.Description: A special type of bunny's favorite carrot.

data.Comments: If kept for a while, becomes a Chicken.
data.Description: A chick that just hatched.
data.Location: Replaces a Fresh Egg in a character's inventory after a certain amount of steps, dropped by Thirsty Coil Snake, dropped by Tough Guy
data.Note: Was rumored to cure Homesickness, but that proved to be false.

data.Comments: Sell for big cash. Will escape if you try to use it.
data.Description: A real, live chicken. Don't eat it, please.
data.Location: Replaces a Chick in a character's inventory after a certain amount of steps.

data.Comments: Can be exchanged for a Pair of dirty socks.
data.Description: It must belong to someone.

data.Comments: Used only by Jeff. Counters enemies' PSI attacks.
data.Description: Items for Jeff. Contains the enemy's PSI during a battle. Can be used many times.
data.Location: Replaces the Broken machine in Jeff's inventory after the item has been repaired.

data.Comments: Same effect as Healing Omega.
data.Description: Revives a friend who is unconscious. In addition, it also works well on poison, nausea, colds, sunstroke, falling asleep, uncontrollable crying and feeling strange. This is effective when you have paralysis, or you have been diamondized.
data.Location: Peaceful Rest Valley (Gift Box), Monkey Cave (Chest), The Pyramid (Gift Box), Dungeon Man (Gift Box), Deep Darkness (Gift Box), Stonehenge base (Gift Box), Lumine Hall (Gift Box)

data.Comments: Used only by Jeff. Increases the Defense of all allies.
data.Description: Increases the Defense of all the friends. It is most effective if you use this power multiple times to "layer" the effect. Can be used many times.
data.Location: Replaces a Broken trumpet in Jeff's inventory after the item is repaired.

data.Comments: Increases one person's Defense.
data.Description: Increase one of the friends Defense during battle. It is most effective if you use this power multiple times to "layer" the effect. Gone after one use.
data.Location: Twoson (Burglin Park), Fourside (Street Salesman), Scaraba (Convenience Store)

data.Comments: Use to pay off the Runaway Five's debt to the Topolla Theater owner.
data.Description: A big, beautiful, and expensive-looking gem.
data.Location: Given by a miner on the Fourside bridge after cleaning the Desert Gold Mine

data.Comments: Erases the Iron Eraser of Stonehenge.
data.Description: Apple Kid's invention. The Eraser eraser erases eraser statues that block Ness's way.
data.Location: Given to you in Dr. Andonuts's lab(Winters) by the No Name Mouse.

data.Comments: Leads you to the exit of caves or mazes.
data.Description: If you use this in a dungeon or some such place, the mouse brings you back to the place where you entered. It's a very smart mouse.

data.Comments: Attracts customers to buy your goods at any time.
data.Description: It invites people to come and buy your unnecessary goods. Can be used many times.

data.Comments: Deflects a Thunder attack.
data.Description: By keeping it as one of your items, it deflects a lightning attack back at the attacker.

data.Comments: User fully recovers HP.
data.Description: A hand-made Band Aid. It heals your wounded body. Gone after one use.

data.Comments: Freezes an enemy during battle.
data.Description: When used as a whip in battle, the enemy takes enough damage to stop moving for a short time. Gone after one use.
data.Location: Moonside (Gift Box), dropped by Cranky Lady, dropped by Extra Cranky Lady

data.Comments: Use to light up the Deep Darkness.
data.Description: What a miracle! Now you can see in the dark!
data.Location: Located in a secret chamber in the Pyramid.

data.Comments: Very powerful weapon used only by Jeff. Can be used multiple times.
data.Description: Items for Jeff. Really dishes out a lot of damage to the enemy during a battle. Because of its explosive power it may effect others besides the target creature. Can be used many times.
data.Location: Replaces a Broken bazooka in Jeff's inventory after the item is repaired.

data.Comments: Explains how to open the Pyramid.
data.Description: A copy of a hieroglyph. Something important is recorded in the ancient characters.

data.Comments: Used only by Jeff. Takes an enemy's HP and adds it to Jeff's.
data.Description: Items for Jeff. Sucks up some HP from the target creature. The more HP the enemy has, the more you get. Can be used many times.

data.Comments: Used only by Jeff. Takes HP from all enemies and adds them to Jeff's HP.
data.Description: Items for Jeff. Sucks up some HP from all the enemies. The more HP the enemies have, the more you get. Can be used many times.
data.Location: Replaces a Broken tube in Jeff's inventory after the item is repaired.

data.Comments: Spray on insect-type monsters.
data.Description: Deals 100 points of damage to any bug when used during combat. Gone after one use.
data.Location: Threed (Drugstore or Garbage), Brick Road Maze (Gift Box), Saturn Valley (Drugstore), Fourside (Department Store)

data.Comments: Return to owner in Twoson hospital to receive a Magic truffle.
data.Description: It doesn't look like it would do much of anything, but...

data.Comments: Use against Master Belch to keep him from attacking.
data.Description: Belch's most favorite food in the whole world. However... it smells REALLY, really nasty! We're talkin' major stinkage here!
data.Location: Threed, dropped by the defeated Boogey Tent.

data.Comments: Use to rescue Paula from the mountain cabin in Peaceful Rest Valley.
data.Description: A key to a holding cell made specially for Paula.

data.Comments: Doesn't open Jeff's locker.
data.Description: A key to a regular locker.

data.Comments: Opens the door to the traveler's shack in Onett.
data.Description: A key to the traveling entertainer's shack.

data.Comments: Use to enter "Dungeon Man."
data.Description: An old key.

data.Comments: Moves monkey from a doorway in the Monkey Cave.
data.Description: A king-sized banana. Not edible.
data.Note: is a reference to giant prize bananas from the Donkey Kong Country game.

data.Description: A letter from the preschool kids to Paula.
A letter from Mom to Ness.
A letter from Tony to Jeff.

data.Comments: Needed for the third Phase Distorter.
data.Description: It looks like a plain old rock, but for someone who knows about it, it is actually a very precious, unusual element.

data.Comments: Sell for a moderate amount of money.
data.Description: It can be sold for a very high price. Nothing happens if you use it. A good explanation is kind of tough...
data.Location: Dropped by Plain Crocodile, dropped by Smilin' Sphere, dropped by Spinning Robo
data.Note: : This item can only be obtained in 1/128 drops.

data.Comments: Sell for big money.
data.Description: It can be sold for a very high price. Nothing happens if you use it. A good explanation is kind of tough...
data.Location: Dropped by Hyper Spinning Robo, dropped by Mechanical Octobot, dropped by Military Octobot, dropped by Whirling Robo, dropped by Soul Consuming Flame, dropped by Evil Eye, dropped by Big Pile of Puke

data.Comments: Used only by Jeff. Stronger than a Big bottle rocket.
data.Description: Items for Jeff. Possibly the strongest weapon around, it does a lot of damage due to its massive warhead. Gone after one use.
data.Location: Scaraba (Grocery Store), Deep Darkness (Secret Weapon Shop), dropped by Even Slimier Little Pile, dropped by Wooly Shambler, dropped by Wild 'N Wooly Shambler

data.Comments: Freezes an enemy during battle.
data.Description: If used as a whip during battle, the enemy will take some damage and stop moving for a while. Gone after one use.
data.Location: Dropped by Shattered Man, dropped by Fierce Shattered Man

data.Comments: Used only by Jeff. Removes all buffs and debuffs, including shields (but not status effects) from all allies and enemies.
data.Description: Items for Jeff. When used during battle, this item resets the abilities of all creatures (friend or enemy) to their normal levels. Any changes that had taken place due to PSI and such is neutralized. It also neutralizes all shields (friend or enemy) that were in effect. (Remember, the abilities that I am talking about are Offense, Defense, Guts, etc.)

data.Comments: Freezes an enemy during battle.
data.Description: When used during battle, the enemy gets so nauseous from the ripe odor, they cannot fight. Gone after one use.

data.Comments: Give to the Balloon Monkey.
data.Description: This is the Balloon Monkey's favorite. It will not help you recover, but you'll also never run out, 'cause it's a super jumbo pack!

data.Comments: Erases Iron Pencils scattered throughout the world.
data.Description: Apple Kid's invention. It makes something blocking your way that looks like a pencil disappear in just a second.

data.Comments: Poisons one enemy during battle.
data.Description: An ectoplasmic ooze is disgorged out of the dreadful box, and the enemy may be poisoned. Gone after one use.
data.Location: The Pyramid (Gift Box), dropped by Guardian Hieroglyph, dropped by Lethal Asp Hieroglyph

data.Comments: No effect.
data.Description: Not really horrible, but the scene on the front doesn't make you want to go there.
data.Location: Happy Happy Village (before defeating Carpainter), Saturn Valley (Drugstore)

data.Comments: Use when searching for Magic Truffles.
data.Description: If you wear this on your nose, you can find and root out magic truffles. Can be used many times. ...let me explain about Magic Truffles. They are a kind of mushroom that grow in damp places, like at the base of big trees. They are almost always buried , so they cannot be seen. If you find one and eat it, it is said to greatly restore a person's PP! You can see more info about the wondrous Magic Truffle after you have obtained one.

data.Comments: No effect (used to "get an angle up on things" in battle). However, there is one grammatical error, if you use the protractor as Paula, it will still say Now, “he” can fairly figure out the angle of various things.
data.Description: You can even use this during battle! Can be used many times.
data.Location: Saturn Valley (Garbage), Fourside (Department Store), Monkey Cave (Chest).

data.Comments: Receives important calls from people like the Apple Kid or your Dad.
data.Description: Apple Kid's invention. Now you can receive important calls.
data.Location: Given in Apple Kid's house by No Name Mouse.
data.Note: As an apparent oversight, you may receive a call from Dad even before you get the item.

data.Comments: No effect (used to "size things up" in battle). However, unlike the protractor, if Paula uses this, it will say she instead of he.
data.Description: You can even use this during battle! Can be used many times.
data.Location: Twoson (Burglin Park), Monkey Cave (Chest), dropped by New Age Retro Hippie

data.Comments: Use against mechanical enemies.
data.Description: Quickly rusts metallic enemies when used during battle. The enemy will take about 200 points of damage. Gone after one use.
data.Location: Twoson (Burglin Park), Threed (Arms Dealer), Saturn Valley (Gift Box), Dusty Dunes Desert (Arms Dealer), Fourside (Street Salesman)

data.Comments: Stronger version of Rust promoter.
data.Description: Causes almost instantaneous rusting when used on metallic enemies during battle. The enemy will take about 400 points of damage. Gone after one use.
data.Location: Fourside Sewer (Gift Box), Deep Darkness (Secret Weapon Shop)

data.Comments: Used only by Jeff. Destroys an enemy's Shield.
data.Description: Items for Jeff. Breaks through the enemy's shield during battle. Can be used many times.
data.Location: Replaces a Broken pipe in Jeff's inventory after the item has been repaired.

data.Comments: Ticket for the Topolla Theater.
data.Description: It says, "Section B, seat 3D."

data.Comments: Cures the Tenda people of their shyness.
data.Description: As the title says, it helps one overcome shyness.

data.Comments: Give to Mr. Spoon to gain entrance to Fourside Sewers.
data.Description: A banana skin with Venus's autograph.

data.Comments: Used only by Jeff. Freezes an enemy during battle.
data.Description: Items for Jeff. Sprays a sticky substance that stops the enemy from moving. Can be used many times.
data.Location: Replaces a Broken iron in Jeff's inventory after the item is repaired.

data.Comments: Use during a battle to poison an enemy.
data.Description: When used during battle, it bites the enemy and disappears. It may also poison the enemy.
data.Location: Scaraba (Snake Shop), Dungeon Man (Gift Box), dropped by Tangoo

data.Comments: Poisons an enemy during battle.
data.Description: During battle, a snake pops out of the bag and bites the enemy. There are thousands of small snakes living in the bag, so you should be able to use it over and over again. It can possibly poison the enemy, too.

data.Comments: Records the melodies from the eight "Your Sanctuary" locations.
data.Description: If you touch this to your forehead and concentrate on your thoughts, your Sanctuary melodies can be heard.

data.Comments: Temporarily freezes an enemy during a battle.
data.Description: By throwing this at the enemy during battle, the enemy is shocked and stops moving. Gone after one use.

data.Comments: Increases Guts during battle.
data.Description: Doubles your guts during battle. However, after a battle, your guts return to normal. Gone after one use.
data.Location: Saturn Valley (Garbage), Monotoli Building (Gift Box), Cave of the Pink Cloud(Gift Box), Scaraba(Hassan's Shop), Dungeon Man (Gift Box), dropped by Enraged Fire Plug, dropped by Musica, dropped by Electro Swoosh, dropped by Desert Wolf, dropped by Enraged Fire Plug, dropped by Petrified Royal Guard

data.Comments: Has the same effect as the Heavy bazooka. Can be used by anyone.
data.Description: Able to dish out some heavy-duty destruction in combat. Because of its explosive power, it may effect others besides the target creature. Gone after one use.
data.Location: Fourside (Arms Dealer), Desert Gold Mine (Gift Box), Scaraba (Weapon Shop), Deep Darkness (Secret Weapon Shop), Lumine Hall (Gift Box), dropped by Atomic Power Robot, dropped by Carefree Bomb, dropped by Nuclear Reactor Robot, dropped by Robo-Pump, dropped by Strong Crocodile

data.Comments: Absorbs damage from enemy attacks.
data.Description: A cute teddy bear!
data.Location: Summers (Drugstore), Dungeon Man (Gift Box), dropped by Mighty Bear Seven, dropped by Hard Crocodile

data.Comments: No effect (plays a song about the Orange Kid, then breaks and disappears).
data.Description: Orange Kid's invention. The full name is the "Super Orange Machine."
data.Note: : Is completely useless. If you have this, congratulations! You wasted your money.

data.Comments: Absorbs damage from enemy attacks.
data.Description: A cute teddy bear!
data.Location: Twoson (Department Store), Threed (Garbage), Fourside (Department Store), Desert Gold Mine (Gift Box)

data.Comments: Use to enter Tenda's dinosaur cage in the Lost Underworld.
data.Description: A very strong-smelling dish. Those who like it go nuts for it...

data.Comments: Allows you to enter the hieroglyph room at a museum.
data.Description: An old treasure from Dalaam.

data.Comments: Freezes an enemy during battle.
data.Description: Can be used during battle. Gone after one use.
data.Location: Threed (Drugstore), Fourside (Department Store), dropped by Unassuming Local Guy

data.Comments: Use to view the layout of a town.
data.Description: A handy town map. It can be used in Onett, as well as other towns. You can view the map quickly, simply by pressing the X button.
data.Location: Onett Library; given by the librarian once spoken to

data.Comments: Most users recover 30 HP. Poo recovers 6 HP.
data.Description: A fashionable treat for snobby, haute cuisine people in some big cities. When eaten, you recover about 30 HP.
data.Location: Can be obtained from Electra in her room in the Monotoli Building (Fourside)

data.Description: What the hey is this?

data.Comments: Use to poison an enemy during battle.
data.Description: When used during battle, it bites the enemy and disappears. It always poisons the enemy.
data.Location: Scaraba (Snake Shop), The Pyramid (Gift Box), dropped by Hostile Elder Oak

data.Comments: Use to rescue the Runaway Five from their debt to the Chaos Theater owner.
data.Description: A bundle of brand new, crisp bills.
data.Location: Given by Everdred after saving Paula.

data.Comments: Exterminates all insect-type monsters on battle screen. A mass and many-use version of the Insecticide Spray.
data.Description: Deals 200 points of damage to any bug when used during combat. Can be used many times.
data.Note: : Can only be gotten from the Mad Taxi as a 1/128 drop.

data.Comments: Give to Electra to gain access to the 48th floor of the Monotoli Building.
data.Description: Items for Jeff. Invented by Apple Kid. If used during combat, some damage will be dealt to the enemy, though its not understood why this happens... it's just yogurt after all... Can be used many times.

data.Comments: Similar to fly paper, but used to trap wandering zombies.
data.Description: Apple Kid's invention. Lay this out in the tent, and the next day, a lot of zombies may be stuck to it.
data.Location: Delivered by Mach Pizza courier shortly after defeating the Boogey Tent

data.Comments: Inexpensive and effective.
data.Description: When eaten, you recover about 24 HP.
data.Location: Onett (Burger Shop), Twoson (Department Store), Fourside (Department Store), dropped by Yes Man Jr.

data.Comments: Sold in Burglin Park.
data.Description: When eaten, you recover about 25 HP.
data.Location: Twoson (Burglin Park), Happy Happy Village (Self-Service Shop), Fourside (Department Store), Scaraba (Hassan's Shop), Deep Darkness (Gift Box)

data.Comments: Sold only in Scaraba.
data.Description: A croquette made with mashed chick peas, then breaded and deep fried. Gen-san in Scaraba loves to cook this. Salt improves it and the olive oil gives it a wonderful flavor. When eaten, you recover about 40 HP.

data.Comments: Can be purchased in Scaraba.
data.Description: Recipe for making jerky. Obtain some type of meat, slice it into pieces about a half of an inch thick. Hang the pieces on a laundry line or something like it and leave out in the sun for maybe 6 months... Well, that's what my recipe says. When eaten, you recover about 150 HP.
data.Location: Scaraba (Grocery Store), Deep Darkness (Trading Company Employee or Gift Box), dropped by Arachnid!!!, dropped by Great Crested Booka, dropped by Manly Fish

data.Comments: One of Jeff's first items.
data.Description: When eaten, you recover about 40 HP.
data.Location: Fourside (Department Store), Scaraba (Delicacy Shop), dropped by No Good fly, dropped by Captain Strong

data.Comments: Especially good for helping Poo recover PP.
data.Description: Very expensive water, but almost the same as the water you drink in town. It recovers PP a little bit.
data.Location: Scaraba (Grocery Store), Deep Darkness (Trading Company Employee), Lumine Hall (Gift Box), Lost Underworld (Grocery Store)

data.Comments: Good for helping Poo recover PP.
data.Description: When you drink it, your PP slightly increases.
data.Location: Summers (Grocery Store), Dalaam (Restaurant), Scaraba (Delicacy Shop), dropped by Conducting Menace, dropped by Thunder Mite

data.Comments: Sold only in Dalaam.
data.Description: An everyday dish in Dalaam. When eaten, you recover about 200 HP.

data.Comments: Increases both HP and PP. A very good healing item that is useful up to the end of the game.
data.Description: When eaten, you recover about 300 HP and about 50 PP.
data.Location: Monkey Cave (Chest), Dalaam (Restaurant), Lost Underworld (Gift Box), dropped by Conducting Spirit, dropped by Starman

data.Description: When eaten, you recover about 30 HP.
data.Location: Onett (Bakery or Gift Box), Twoson (Department Store or Burglin Park), Threed (Bakery), Brick Road Maze (Gift Box), Fourside (Department Store or Bakery), dropped by Rowdy Mouse, dropped by Runaway Dog

data.Description: When eaten, you recover about 60 HP.
data.Location: Threed (Drugstore), The Belch Base (Gift Box), Dusty Dunes Desert (Drugstore), Fourside (Department Store), Desert Gold Mine (Gift Box)

data.Description: If you drink this, you recover about 6 HP.
data.Location: Onett (Burger Shop or Garbage), Twoson (Department Store or Burglin Park), Happy Happy Village (Drugstore), Threed (Bakery), Dusty Dunes Desert (Drugstore), Fourside (Department Store), Summers (Restaurant or Grocery Store)

data.Comments: Sold only in Summers.
data.Description: This is today's special. It is highly recommended by our chef, who trained at a five-star restaurant in Paris. When eaten, you recover about 200 HP.

data.Comments: The first food item you'll find.
data.Description: When eaten, you recover about 6 HP.
data.Location: Onett (Bakery), Twoson (Department Store or Burglin Park), Threed (Bakery), Snow Wood Boarding School in Winters (Gift Box), Fourside (Bakery), dropped by Spiteful Crow, dropped by Worthless Protoplasm

data.Comments: Good to have in Happy Happy Village and Threed.
data.Description: When eaten, you recover about 60 HP.
data.Location: Lilliput Steps (Gift Box), Peaceful Rest Valley (Gift Box), Threed (Bakery), Brick Road Maze (Gift Box), Fourside (Department Store or Bakery), Desert Gold Mine (Gift Box), Fourside Sewer (Gift Box), dropped by Mobile Sprout, dropped by Mole Playing Rough, dropped by Putrid Moldyman

data.Comments: Expensive and not very effective.
data.Description: If you drink this, you recover about 12 HP. I guess it tastes good to adults.
data.Location: Onett (Burger Shop), Twoson (Department Store or Burglin Park), Happy Happy Village (Drugstore), Threed (Bakery), Winters (Drugstore or Dr. Andonuts' Lab), Fourside (Department Store), Summers (Restaurant or Grocery Store), Scaraba (Delicacy Shop), dropped by Scalding Coffee Cup

data.Comments: Expensive and not very effective.
data.Description: You know what this is... When eaten, you recover about 40 HP.

data.Comments: Handy in Fourside.
data.Description: When eaten, you recover about 90 HP. 100% beef.
data.Location: Fourside (Department Store), Moonside (Gift Box), Winters (Dr. Andonuts' Lab), dropped by Gigantic Ant, dropped by Caveboy, dropped by Elder Batty, dropped by Over Zealous Cop

data.Comments: Keep it until it hatches and becomes a Chicken.
data.Description: When eaten, you recover about 80 HP. So fresh, it's still warm.
data.Location: Twoson (Burglin Park), Happy Happy Village (Self-Service Shop), Monkey Cave, Winters (Dr. Andonuts' Lab), Scaraba (Delicacy Shop), dropped by Mad Duck

data.Comments: Sold only in Summers.
data.Description: Ice cream that is all the rage among fashionable, young women. When eaten, you recover about 30 HP.

data.Comments: Very handy in Onett and Twoson.
data.Description: When eaten, you recover about 50 HP. 100% beef.
data.Location: Onett (Burger Shop or Garbage or Gift Box), The Caves at Giant Step (Gift Box), Twoson (Department Store), Fourside (Department Store), Monkey Cave (Chest), dropped by Pogo Punk, dropped by Urban Zombie

data.Comments: Sold only at the bazaar in Scaraba.
data.Description: Broiled lamb's liver, etc. all served on a skewer. Sometimes meat other than lamb is included... that's what someone told me... When eaten, you recover about 120 HP.

data.Comments: Completely refills everyone's HP.
data.Description: Soup made from the fin of the sea monster known as Kraken. This beast lives in the ocean off the shore of Summers. Very expensive, but a sizable power boost is guaranteed.

data.Comments: Everyone recovers 240 HP.
data.Description: Since it's a really big pizza, everyone can recover about 240 HP.
data.Location: Ordered by phone from Mach Pizza, dropped by Stinky Ghost

data.Comments: Recover HP and PP in random amounts.
data.Description: It helps you recover your power... How much and exactly what you recover depends on your luck!
data.Location: Onett (Bakery), Twoson (Department Store or Burglin Park), Happy Happy Village (Drugstore), Threed (Bakery), Winters (Drugstore), Dusty Dunes Desert (Drugstore), Fourside (Bakery), Summers (Grocery Store)
data.Hit points up: 60 HP or 240 HP or Full, 6 HP (Poo)

data.Comments: Sold only in the Lost Underworld.
data.Description: A gourmet version of jerky that is considered a delicacy. It is created by a skillful artisan who has been making jerky for over 60 years. Jerky fans consider this the caviar of all jerkys. I understand that they don't dry gourmet jerky on a laundry line... When eaten, you recover about 300 HP.
data.Location: Lost Underworld (Grocery Store), dropped by Wetnosaur

data.Comments: Sold only in Magicant.
data.Description: Recovers about 40 PP.

data.Comments: Sold only in Summers.
data.Description: Replenishes 20 PP.
data.Location: Summers (Street Vendor), Magicant (Gift Box), dropped by Mr. Molecule

data.Comments: Search for these in the Deep Darkness with the Piggy nose.
data.Description: A dream-like delicacy that is said to grow at the base of trees in wet, muddy places. It restores about 80 PP.
data.Location: random locations in Deep Darkness, given by a man in Twoson hospital in exchange for Insignificant item

data.Comments: Sold only in the Lost Underworld.
data.Description: When eaten, you recover about 200 HP.

data.Comments: Sold only in Scaraba.
data.Description: Molokheiya is a summer vegetable from Scaraba. It's high in nutrients, and it has a light flavor that Scarabans love. If you drink this, you recover about 80 HP.

data.Comments: Sold only in a restaurant in Summers.
data.Description: This is a pasta dish which legend holds was a favorite of King Summers the Third in the 16th century. Back then, there were many great chefs, confident of their culinary skills, always going to and from Summer's Palace. One day, King Summers wife, Anna Summers, said, "Oh what I wouldn't give for some really delicious pasta!" ... ... ... ...Well, let's just leave it at that. The story is too long to go through completely... but it really is a beautiful, touching tale... When eaten, you recover about 110 HP.

data.Comments: The Mr. Saturns' favorite. Inexpensive but effective.
data.Description: It's one of Mr. Saturn's favorite foods. It tastes pretty yummy. When eaten, you recover about 100 HP.

data.Comments: Use in the Dusty Dunes Desert.
data.Description: When eaten, you recover abut 80 HP. There's even a slice of your favorite cake!
data.Location: Winters (Drugstore or Dr. Andonuts' Lab), Dusty Dunes Desert (Drugstore), Fourside (Department Store), Desert Gold Mine (Gift Box), Monkey Cave (Chest), dropped by Ranboob

data.Comments: Sold only in Saturn Valley.
data.Description: It's one of Mr. Saturn's favorite foods. It tastes all right. When eaten, you recover about 300 HP.

data.Comments: Mmmm! Delivered piping Hot!
data.Description: When eaten, you recover about 120 HP.
data.Location: Monkey Cave (Chest), Dungeon Man (Gift Box), ordered from Mach Pizza, dropped by Skate Punk, dropped by Mystical Record, dropped by Mostly Bad Fly

data.Comments: Receive in a trade with the Tenda.
data.Description: I don't have a lot to say about this. I guess there are some people who think it's good. When eaten, you recover about 80 HP.

data.Comments: Earn in a trade in Tenda.
data.Description: Tastes okay in some respects. When eaten, you recover about 160 HP.

data.Comments: Can be purchased only in the Dusty Dunes Desert.
data.Description: When eaten, you recover about 18 HP.
data.Location: Sold for $7 at the Dusty Dunes Desert after defeating the 5 Guardian Diggers.

data.Comments: Refreshing!
data.Description: For building a stronger, healthier body. It gives you a blast of nourishment when you are fatigued. If you drink this, you recover about 80 HP.
data.Location: Grapefruit Falls (Gift Box), Fourside (Department Store), Moonside (Gift Box), Monkey Cave (Chest), Scaraba (Hassan's Shop), Deep Darkness (Trading Company Employee), dropped by Annoying Old Party Man, dropped by Annoying Reveler

data.Description: Replenishes 20 PP.
data.Location: Lilliput Steps (Gift Box), Desert Gold Mine (Gift Box), Dungeon Man (Gift Box), Stonehenge base (Gift Box), Magicant (Gift Box), dropped by Dali's Clock, dropped by Insane Cultist, dropped by Territorial Oak, dropped by Final Starman, dropped by Fobby, dropped by Foppy, dropped by Lesser Mook, dropped by Loaded Dice, dropped by Mook Senior, dropped by Psychic Psycho, dropped by Ultimate Octobot, dropped by Zap Eel
data.Note: : Every enemy that drops this item has a 1/128 chance of dropping it.

data.Comments: Sold only in Summers.
data.Description: The highest quality tea, produced by tea expert Mr. Y. Todaar, who carefully selects only hand-picked tea leaves. Long ago, only aristocrats at a king's court were allowed to drink this tea. If you drink this, you recover about 60 HP.

data.Comments: Walk very fast for about 10 seconds.
data.Description: Gives you a spring in your step for about 10 seconds. It also helps you recover your power a bit.
data.Location: Onett (Bakery), The Caves at Giant Step (Gift Box), Twoson (Department Store or Burglin Park or Gift Box), Happy Happy Village (Drugstore), Threed (Bakery or Garbage), Dusty Dunes Desert (Drugstore), Fourside (Bakery), dropped by Fierce Shattered Man, dropped by Farm Zombie
data.Note: : Can be used to get out of bounds in several places.

data.Comments: Walk very fast for about 20 seconds.
data.Description: Gives you a spring in your step for about 20 seconds. It also helps you recover your power a bit.
data.Location: Winters (Drugstore), Underground Road (Coffin), Fourside (Bakery), Summers (Grocery Store), dropped by Ego Orb, dropped by High-class UFO

data.Comments: Barter in Tenda for this item.
data.Description: Recipe for making spicy jerky. Obtain some type of meat, slice it into pieces about a half of an inch thick. Season the pieces as much as possible, hang the pieces on a laundry line or something like it and leave out in the sun for maybe 8 months... Well, that's what my recipe says... When eaten, you recover about 250 HP.
data.Location: Stonehenge base (Gift Box), Lumine Hall (Gift Box), exchanged from Tenda Village trader, dropped by Demonic Petunia

data.Comments: Use with Banana, Luck sandwich, Popsicle or Trout yogurt.
data.Description: To use, sprinkle over food. A good combination increases the strength of your recovery.
data.Location: Twoson (Burglin Park), Fourside (Department Store), Scaraba (Seasoning Shop), dropped by Noose Man

data.Comments: Use with any food item.
data.Description: Use by sprinkling it over food. It tastes good with any kind of food, thereby increasing the recovery power of the food.
data.Location: Dalaam (Restaurant), dropped by Kiss of Death

data.Comments: Use with Cup of Noodles, Pasta di Summers or Pizza.
data.Description: To use, sprinkle over food. A good combination increases the strength of your recovery.
data.Location: Twoson (Burglin Park), Fourside (Department Store), Scaraba (Seasoning Shop), dropped by Arachnid!, dropped by Mr. Batty

data.Comments: Use with Bag of fries, Bean croquette, Beef jerky, Croissant, Double burger, Fresh Egg, Hamburger, Kabob, Luxury jerky, Magic truffle, Mammoth burger or Spicy jerky.
data.Description: To use, sprinkle over food. A good combination increases the strength of your recovery.
data.Location: Twoson (Burglin Park), Fourside (Department Store), Scaraba (Seasoning Shop), dropped by Dread Skelpion, dropped by Ramblin' Evil Mushroom

data.Comments: Use with Boiled egg, Brain food lunch, Chef's special and Picnic lunch.
data.Description: To use, sprinkle over food. A good combination increases the strength of your recovery.
data.Location: Twoson (Burglin Park), Fourside (Department Store), Scaraba (Seasoning Shop), dropped by Gruff Goat, dropped by Pitbull Slug

data.Comments: Use with Bowl of rice gruel, Peanut cheese bar or Piggy jelly.
data.Description: To use, sprinkle over food. A good combination increases the strength of your recovery.
data.Location: Twoson (Burglin Park), Fourside (Department Store), Scaraba (Seasoning Shop), dropped by Tough Mobile Sprout

data.Comments: Use with Bread roll, Calorie stick, Magic pudding, Magic tart, Plain yogurt, PSI caramel or Rock candy.
data.Description: To use, sprinkle over food. A good combination increases the strength of your recovery.
data.Location: Twoson (Burglin Park), Fourside (Department Store), Scaraba (Seasoning Shop), dropped by Red Antoid

data.Comments: Use with Cookie, Gelato de resort, Plain roll, Skip sandwich or Skip sandwich DX.
data.Description: To use, sprinkle over food. A good combination increases the strength of your recovery.
data.Location: Twoson (Burglin Park), Fourside (Department Store), Scaraba (Seasoning Shop), dropped by Handsome Tom

data.Comments: Cures a cold.
data.Description: This is the most effective thing to take when you catch a cold.
data.Location: Onett (Drugstore), The Caves at Giant Step (Gift Box), Twoson (Department Store), Threed (Drugstore), Fourside (Department Store)

data.Comments: Permanently increases Guts by 1.
data.Description: It increases your Guts by 1 when taken.
data.Location: Desert Gold Mine (Gift Box), Stonehenge base (Gift Box), Lost Underworld (Gift Box)

data.Comments: Completely cures unconsciousness and all other adverse conditions. The same effect as Healing Omega.
data.Description: Revives a friend who is unconscious. In addition, it also works well with poison, nausea, colds, sunstroke, falling asleep, uncontrollable crying, and feeling strange. This is effective when you have paralysis, or if you have been diamondized.
data.Location: Saturn Valley (Drugstore), Lost Underworld (Gift Box in Grocery Store), the Fire Spring (Gift Box), dropped by Manly Fish's Brother, dropped by French Kiss of Death, dropped by Squatter Demon
data.Note: : Possibly the hardest 1/128 item to get.

data.Comments: Permanently increases IQ by 1.
data.Description: It increases your IQ by 1 when taken.
data.Location: The Belch Base (Gift Box), Desert Gold Mine (Gift Box), Deep Darkness (Gift Box), Lumine Hall (Gift Box)

data.Comments: Permanently increases Luck by 1.
data.Description: It increases your Luck by 1 when taken.
data.Location: Peaceful Rest Valley (Gift Box), Desert Gold Mine (Gift Box), Lumine Hall (Gift Box)

data.Comments: Cures a cold, sunstroke, crying, poison, feeling strange and nausea. The same effect as Healing Beta.
data.Description: It helps when you have been poisoned, or you are feeling nauseous. It also has other uses... colds, sunstroke, falling asleep, uncontrollable crying, and feeling strange.
data.Location: Threed (Drugstore), Saturn Valley (Drugstore), Dusty Dunes Desert (Drugstore), Fourside (Department Store), dropped by Abstract Art, dropped by Smilin' Sam

data.Comments: Permanently increases one attribute by 1.
data.Description: When you eat this, it will increase either Speed, Guts, Vitality, IQ or Luck.
data.Location: Cave of the Pink Cloud (Gift Box), Deep Darkness (Gift Box), Lumine Hall (Gift Box)
data.Notes: Can be used infinitely with a glitch.

data.Comments: Cures all bad conditions and wakes someone who is unconscious. The same effect as Healing Gamma. Is a stronger version of the Refreshing herb.
data.Description: May revive a friend who is unconscious. In addition, it also works well on poison, nausea, colds, sunstroke, falling asleep, uncontrollable crying, and feeling strange. This is effective when you have paralysis, or you have been diamondized.
data.Location: Saturn Valley (Drugstore), Desert Gold Mine (Gift Box), Moonside (Gift Box), Winters (Dr. Andonuts' Lab), Summers (Grocery Store), Scaraba (Hassan's Shop or Grocery Store), Deep Darkness (Trading Company Employee), dropped by Violent Roach, dropped by Zombie Possessor

data.Comments: Permanently increases Speed by 1.
data.Description: It increases your Speed by 1 when taken.
data.Location: The Pyramid (Gift Box), Stonehenge base (Gift Box), The Fire Spring (Gift Box)

data.Comments: Permanently increases Vitality by 1.
data.Description: It increases your Vitality by 1 when taken.
data.Location: The Belch Base (Gift Box), Monotoli Building in Fourside(Gift Box)

data.Comments: Works as an antidote for poisoning.
data.Description: This is the best thing to take when you get poisoned.
data.Location: Threed (Drugstore), Scaraba (Hassan's Shop, Snake Shop), dropped by Skelpion

data.Comments: This item is meant to cure sunstroke, but can also heal any other status Healing Alpha heals.
data.Description: It's great for those times that you get sunstroke.
data.Location: Dusty Dunes Desert (Drugstore), Monkey Cave (Chest), Scaraba (Hassan's Shop), Dungeon Man (Gift Box)
